content.question: A real estate agent wants to predict the selling price of single-family homes from the size of each house. A scatterplot created from a sample of houses shows an exponential relationship between price, in thousands of dollars, and size, in 100 square feet. To create a linear model, the natural logarithm of price was taken and the least-squares regression line was given as <math alttext="the natural log of, open parenthesis, price hat, close parenthesis, equals 2.08 plus, 0.11 times size" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>‚Å°</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mover><mrow><mi>p</mi><mi>r</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2.08</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>0.11</mn><mo>(</mo><mrow><mi>s</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>z</mi><mi>e</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Based on the model, which of the following is closest to the predicted selling price for a house with a size of 3,200 square feet?

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Calculate summary statistics, relative positions of points within a distribution, correlation, and predicted response.
